page.title: 08Family Life
page.content: The Johnston family live at midtown farm.My Dad and Mum both work on the farm.My brother David and I help Dad with the lambing and haytiming.My Dad works very long hours at lambing time he gets up at 6.am and works until 10.pm.We buy and breed calves and keep them until they are about one and a half years old.Then they are sold at the auction.We keep sheep.The gimmer lambs from the sheep are sold at Lazonby auction in September and the whether lambs are sold as stores.The smaller lambs are kept they are put onto turnips and meal and are sold about christmas time.In January we start fencing and walling up until lambing time in march. We are lambing until the end of April.Then we sow the barley and turnips.In July we haytime. In September the sheep from the fell are sorted for sale.
